findings.title: No transfer event emitted when basic transfer called.
findings.description: The contract does not emit a transfer event when a basic transfer is called.

findings.title: Owner can authorize / unauthorize addresses.
findings.description: The owner has privileges to authorize or unauthorize addresses, which can lead to unauthorized access and manipulation of contract functionality.

findings.title: Authorized Addresses Can Initiate Buyback
findings.description: Authorized addresses can call triggerMarsRun to initiate a buyback.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can clear buyback multiplier
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the capability to clear the buyback multiplier, which could lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can change auto buyback settings.
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the privilege to modify auto buyback settings, which could lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can change buyback multiplier settings.
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the privilege to modify buyback multiplier settings, which may lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can launch contract
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the capability to initiate the launch of a smart contract.

findings.title: Authorized Addresses Can Change Maximum Transaction Amount
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the privilege to modify the maximum transaction amount, which can lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Authorized Addresses Can Include/Exclude from Dividends
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the capability to include or exclude certain addresses from receiving dividends.

findings.title: Authorized Addresses Can Include/Exclude from Fees
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the capability to include or exclude specific addresses from fees, which could lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can include in and exclude from transaction amount limit.
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the ability to modify transaction amount limits, which could lead to potential security issues.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can change fees
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the capability to modify fee settings, which could lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can change fee receivers
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the capability to modify the recipients of fees, which could lead to unauthorized changes and potential security risks.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can change swap threshold and enable / disable swap.
findings.description: Authorized addresses have excessive privileges to modify critical contract settings, potentially leading to unintended behavior or security risks.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can change target liquidity values
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the privilege to modify target liquidity values, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can change distribution criteria
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the privilege to modify distribution criteria, which may lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Authorized addresses can change distribution GAS.
findings.description: Authorized addresses have the privilege to modify the distribution gas settings, which could lead to unintended consequences.
